review_title: An honest review that will reveal my identity to those I worked with - but I do not care
job_title: Audiology Assistant in Burnsville, MN
pros:
-Pay is decent, yearly reviews with possibility of increase (Range for this job is 21-27 depending on experience)
-Patients are mostly kind and thankful for your help
-If you like tinkering, the actual repairing of the hearing aids can be really fun (repetitive too, but I didn't mind)
-Primarily sitting (if you like that) but you do get to get up and walk around a bit, depending on how many patients you have scheduled
-Lunch is an hour (half paid, half unpaid, don't ask me why)
-Benefits are very nice
-PTO is pretty flexible for this location for this position, even on short notice, as long as patients aren't already scheduled
-Schedule can be accommodating for your preferences (I chose 7:30-4)
-I REALLY liked establishing relationships with patients. Some were so kind and really loved talking to me. I had patients call me and wish me happy holidays and some just to say thank you for my help because they were so grateful. It was really heartwarming to make a difference. It made it all worthwhile.
cons:
-It takes about 6 months to really get into the flow of this position. There are just so many things to learn. Even a year in I had to ask questions occasionally.
-This position has no room to grow within the department without getting further licensure (AuD). You'd have to move within the company
-Job wears a lot of hats and hats are constantly being added, there is no ability to set boundaries. If you did, you'd most definitely either get told on by staff or talked to by management (or both).
-Management will act as if they are listening to you, but nothing actually gets done. They will seem empathetic and caring. It's a façade. Don't fall for it. It's there from the interview. It will go on for months. But it will slowly and surely break. 
-With that in mind, you will be left alone, working hard, and only to be contacted when enough complaints have been made about you about the most trivial things. Complaints were never about my work ethic, only about my attitude (which I still don't understand what attitude I had to be frank), as far as I was told. 
-Some locations are better than others, your experience will entirely depend on the audiologists you assist. I was unlucky that one was extremely disrespectful, one stressed everyone out (although they are no longer there), and another had a complaint for every mistake you made (and told management any time they felt you were talking back).
-It's the kind of job where only your mistakes are noticed... if you're doing things right you're not acknowledged. It starts to wear on you

job_title: Lab Assistant/Phlebotomist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great coworkers, good benefits, convenient location
cons:
I work in the lab as a phlebotomist or lab assistant,  I do not know where to begin. Honestly, I have worked here for quite some time, and I have seen too many people come and go to even count. We have extremely high turn over as of late, people are dissatisfied, including myself, and when the opportunity arises, I will be gone to. Some factors that contribute to the overall unhappiness are : 
* We are constantly understaffed (people call in "sick" ,but I think people are just worn out)
*Our managers/supervisors/team leads all have egos and they all want power,most of them do not really know what they are doing
*They always tell us they welcome our suggestions,but when you give them suggestions and speak up ,they view you as a trouble maker
*The only way you can "get ahead" is by being someone's pet, the nepotism at this place is unreal!
*Our technology does not work(handhelds), it is quite antiquated
*Dealing with some nurses can be sheer terror , most of them have bad attitudes, some of them are bigots, and most of them are lacking in the common sense department
*Management could care less about employees who have been there for years, yet they cater to the newer employees, or the employees who could give a crap
*Pay is not competitive, new employees start off making as much as someone who has been there for years
*High management/supervisor/team lead turnover
* Seniority does not exist

job_title: Call Center Representative in Wayzata, MN
pros: Consistent hours, part time hours if desired, decent benefits.
cons: I was hired at a "slightly" higher hourly rate for my position due to my overqualification and past experiences. Each year my annual reviews at Park Nicollet consisted of "role molel" or "exceeds expectations" in every single category. I've received a total of 70 cents per hour in increases spanning over 3 years.  When I questioned, "why the low raises when my reviews are so good?"  I was told that "pay increases are not based on performance at all. And, because I was hired at a slightly higher rate than my peers, they needed to balance it out over time until my peers caught up to me. But we think you are doing great and you are an asset to Park Nicollet." I've never felt so de-motivated to work above and beyond the call of duty.  I'll be looking for another job where above average employees are rewarded fairly for their work.

review_title: Park Nicollet is a good place to work!!!
job_title: Staff RN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I am an RN at Park Nicollet on a general medical floor. The coworkers are really nice to work with and we are all team players helping answer call lights. If someone is having a busy day, you know that you can ask for help without being looked down on. The salary is nice, as well as the PTO and sick time. They also reimburse you for your student loans and help with tuition reimbursement when you go on in school.
cons: They have been denying everyone's vacation requests lately. To even be approved for vacation you can only request it up to 3 months ahead and then it is not even guaranteed.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros:
Great pay
Beautiful facility
Employee discount at cafeteria
cons:
Crappy work culture
Coworkers go behind your back to complain about you to your manager
No safe place to put belongings
Constantly changing protocols
Favoritism shown
Seniority gives some workers “the right” to be rude and disrespectful to coworkers
Poor communication
There is a rule that an employee can not be absent for more than 3% of their appointment, this isn’t fair to very part time employees. Working 16h per pay period would limit the employee to only being allowed to be sick for 2 days a year. Going over can lead to being reprimanded.

job_title: Patient Financial Services Representative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Most supervisors had a very open door policy. You get to utilize your PTO as soon as it's earned, no waiting 3+ months to use earned PTO like at other companies. Lots of potlucks makes it feel less like a call center environment. Not a job you have to take home with you so that's nice.
cons: Not a whole TON of room for advancement. Definitely a range of ages in employees so if you're looking to connect with your coworkers, don't count on it. A lot

review_title: it was an interesting and fun experience.
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: It's a well known company.  The people are very nice and friendly.  The vacation benefits are great you get 29 days as a full time employee your first year.  Company values are the same everywhere, nothing different.  the The work life balance is great as a salaried employee.
cons: The training was very minimal and disorganized at best.  Lots of different direction from too many different people.  There are different expectations for different people with no accountability.  The pay for the job was much lower than standard.  I took a huge pay cut to come here.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minnetonka, MN
pros: Good benefits and flexible scheduling depending on your area's leadership.  Patient centered, great patient care teams (nurses, Drs, MAs).
cons: Inability to move up unless you know the 'right people'.  I have worked here 10 years with an exemplary work record, attained a BS in Health Administration and still told my degree and extensive experience means nothing to this organization.  It is all who you know here....not what you know.

review_title: Working at Park-Nicollet was one of the best jobs I've ever had.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: The work culture and atmosphere around Park Nicollet is amazing. Supervisors and co-workers all chip in and work together to get things done and management is very understanding and accommodating. I often had time to get school work done while working and was even given extra learning opportunities at work that were related to my field. Picking up and dropping shifts was very straight forward and easily done, which made job flexibility a huge plus. Very pleasurable experience, I would definitely recommend it. Raises are available, and there is even a fixed yearly increase on each check.
cons: The only cons to working there is that the cafeteria only serves diet soda, which can be worked around if you know how to get the real stuff.

review_title: Negative workplace- constant reorganization and few rewards for employees
job_title: in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: In the metro area, on the busline.
cons: negative workplace. Management VS staff mentality. I left my job due these same reasons. Since I have left, I keep seeing the same jobs posted on the grid, off, then back on. What does this tell us? It tells us there is little to no support from upper managment, lack of training, and lack of encouragement to employees. People are either being fired or leave because there is NO SUPPORT and COMPLETE LACK OF TRAINING. Expected to hit the floor running without proper preceptorship. This is a liability to them as well as employees. I expected to work in this nice subburban hospital, but what I found was a negative workplace with REALLY stressed out employees fearful of loosing their jobs! WOW....

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros:
High level of patient and family centered care.
A lot of community involvement - Foundation is doing great work.
CEO does a good job of communicating and trying to ensure that everyone is focused on the same mission with the same values.
cons:
Lack of consistent messaging and values from department to department.
Leaders are often promoted into their role based on their individual contributor success versus their ability to lead or manage.

review_title: Melrose: Lmited therapeution focus too much on dbt therapy
job_title: Psychologist in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Melrose :  Lovely setting, respect from peers, flexible re many personal preferences, much collaborative support from management, good benefits but eating disorders work is definitely not for everyone.
cons: Melrose: Can be very pressured workplace with demanding patients and you will be busy constantly, with the additional expectation of being willing to always do more. You will be expected to want to add weekend and evening hours or you will be deemed not to be a team player

review_title: Great place to start building your retirement fund
job_title: HIM Associate in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Great retirement package and a very nice amount of PTO given to employees. Many benefits to take advantage of.
cons: The different departments do not communicate or work well together. If you are not part of management or related to management, then your opinions and voice don't count. They'll ask for ideas and opinions, but it seems all for the sake of covering their bases. Like another reviewer said, it certainly is a "good ole boy" atmosphere. Not just in my department, in several areas of the system. You'll advance in the company by who you know, not what you know. Time off "rules" apply to some employees and not others.

job_title: Urgent Care Provider in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Good orientation. Good comp and benefits.
cons: Lack of team work between providers and nurses. Nurses don't seem interested in assisting provider to be more efficient. Provider often left to waste time finding procedure supplies in a cupboard that is locked for which they don't have a key, if the patient was even placed in the correct room to begin with (which often didn't happen). There is pressure on provider to be efficient so patients are not waiting, nursing staff don't seem to share this goal and because they are not assigned to one particular provider there is less accountability. Even though this organization is lead by physicians they have been unable to change this culture.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Co-workers- most are good, Patients, Pay- get paid more as non-contract vs union, Benefits are decent, hard to accrue PTO though with being pool called when census is low.
cons: Mangement, Lack of communication, Since HP took over there has been a lot of changes and not for the better. They have "let go" of many staff saying they found new jobs when in fact they didn't and were fired. Staff across the board feels afraid for their jobs and wonder when they will "let go" of more staff and replace them with HP employees.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great company that offers great benefits!  Supervisors were always understanding and flexible.  My supervisor was also very helpful when informed that I'd be searching for another opportunity and even helped to be a reference!
cons: The call volume and not feeling like you get enough breaks with the amount of calls on a daily.  Other peers worrying about other peers business and not focusing on the work.

job_title: Various Over Years in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Decent salary and benefits.  
Many locations available for work.  
Able to find jobs from full-time, part time or casual.  Great way to work toward retirement
Wonderful medical care provided to patients
cons:
Little recognition of “lower level” employees
Favoritism
Very minimal salary increases - not based on performance
The “Head and Heart together” philosophy does not apply equally at all levels
Vacation/sick time lumped together -does not increase much after 10 years

job_title: Recruiter in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The culture here when I began was very friendly and flexible.  Most of the people I encountered were pleasant and joyful to work with aside from the manager and director in our dept.
cons: It was disappointing to join the team to have little to know training or on-boarding.  When asked for development opportunities or assistance, management turned a cheek and later would comment on lack of knowledge around process or operations.  This is a department in which the wrong people are in leadership roles and not recognizing the talent in front of them but rather expect them to make them look good with out appropriate tools.

review_title: Used to be a great place to work, now it's just OK
job_title: IT Project Manager in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Compensation is actually pretty good compared to other healthcare organizations in Minneapolis. Lots of PTO. Ability to work from home when needed. Adequate training budget to keep your skills up to date - in IT at least. Large variety in the type of systems / projects in the computing environment.
cons: Leadership in IT has changed significantly in since 2009 - new crew will demote or fire you for not agreeing with their views. Leadership is often over confident and ill informed.

review_title: Working in clinical radiology was excellent, my department management polices were not.
job_title: Radiology Technologist in Burnsville, MN
pros: Was allowed to go above and beyond to support patient care in other departments.
cons: My radiology department did not support me as an outstanding Radiology Technologist at all.

review_title: Overall as a new nurse I learned alot but in the end I felt like day to day was repetitive
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Doctors are cool, SOME coworkers are cool, and weekends off (but I was guilt tripped into working more than req saturday clinic)
cons: Team lead was not welcoming 😒, very clique type environment, mgmt doesn't know day to day procedures😒 short staffed, changing protocols whenever mgmt feels suitable, pt can show up 2 hr late and the team is forced to accommodate them😵when new mgmt came rounds stopped, no communication 🙄 esp if you needed backup from mgmt, and lots of upper lvl work delegated that shouldn't be

job_title: Ophthalmic Technician in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Employees are treated as an asset.  The work load is fairly low.  Employees are generally happy with most having worked there for 10+ years.  Doctors are friendly and very approachable.
cons: COMT's and treated significantly better than other staff with significantly more benefits.  No drive to train on additional testing/jobs- you need to seek that out yourself.  Staff is allowed to work as hard or slow as they want without recognition.  Raises are based souly on pre-set values

job_title: Claims Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: PTO, able to pick your shift, easy tasks
cons: Inconsistency all over the department (training, management, rule enforcing, etc) Management can be hostile, like to bully, and belittle certain employees. Facilities are atrocious , building is very old, dirty and deteriorating.  Pay is not competitive at all.  Weird, strict dress code enforcement.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: pay and benefits are good, opportunity for advancement is high
cons: depending on your position you can feel that you are treated more insignificantly than others

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Patient Friendly, diverse, growing industry, doctors are awesome
cons: No help to find positions and expand knowledge to move around in the company, Passive/ Agresive approach to coaching and reviews  Only place that Bullying is still allowed under the guise of "Coaching".  Favoritism runs rampant-Bosses and coworkers are friends outside of work.  "Nepotism: the practice among those with power or influence of favoring relatives or friends, especially by giving them jobs"

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Overall, the benefits are good.
cons:
Park NIcollet does not pay employees for their accrued PTO time when they leave the company.

 I had to wait 1.5 years in order to be eligible to the employer match to my 401K. The company does not do quarterly matches for the 401K, but does the match at the end of the calendar year and the employee must be active as of the last day of the calendar year in order to receive any match.

review_title: Park Nicollet/Healthpartners are closing all of their pharamcies
job_title: Pharmacist in Minnetonka, MN
pros: Salary, schedule and benefits are good.  Able to supply quality health care to patients
cons: It was decided that money is more important to the higher ups of the company than supplying quality care to patients.  At the end of the day it is all about money.

review_title: It was a good place to work, at first...
job_title: Information Technology in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: Lots of opportunity for growth, trusted employees, almost unlimited learning in the IT department.
cons: Management changes frequently, no overall direction or 3 year plan, too much playing politics instead of doing the right thing.

review_title: I had an excellent experience working for Park Nicollet
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: I worked part time and had a set schedule that I could count on. My supervisor was flexible. The training was complete and I never felt that sink or swim feeling you get when starting at some jobs.
cons: There were some scheduled 10 hour shifts that were difficult. Working in a call center, there was a lot of supervision that seemed unnecessary.

job_title: Concierge in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Management is very kind and understanding re: personal issues. They make sure you have the understanding and tools to do your job professionally. I think Park Nicollet as a whole has a great grasp of family values.. The employees are very knowledgeable. They all work well as a team. Excellent pay. Wonderfull company to work for!
cons: for me there are no downsides of working for Park Nicollet

job_title: Staff RN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The staff I work with throughout the hospital on the night shift are beyond awesome. They are very friendly, welcoming, and work together well as a team for the best of outcomes for the patient.
cons: It's very frustrating continually working short, and only being staffed in four hour block increments. And the Staffing Department needs to answer the phone with a human.

job_title: Scientist in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: A very solid place for health and medical research. Many talented and intelligent colleagues. Dynamic research environment, many opportunities to build skills and professional relationships.
cons: Overall this is a great institute for health and medical research. A suggestion for improving the work environment would be to let various types of research staff work more according to their professional role, e.g., academic researchers have a very different daily work routine distinct from nurses, clinicians, etc.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: This was my 1st job as an LPN so I have no other exp. Pros would be my schedule, PTO requests ate simple now, if you want to make a chage management is willing, I am not afraid to speak my mind, management always wants to help, my department is all about teamwork, strenuous activity on my body is a minimal.
cons: Favoritism making some employees feel neglected. Lots of micro managing.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: There is no pros to working st park nicollet. It's hell. Thank God I'm gone
cons: They are all about making money and not so much about there employees. You dont get your full breaks. It's ok for managers to take time off but if ur not one of those you SOL. Pay sucks. You have to use your own PTO for holidays. They don't care if ur sick while working with patients. They just bring on anyone. Turnover rate is high

job_title: Applications Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great people I worked with - just about everyone was moving in the same direction in order to get that firm away from LastWord to Epic/
cons: Management was incredibly "hands off" about making sure things worked, but were all over people like crazy if anything negative was said about them.

review_title: Loved the first years but management changed and with that came low moral.
job_title: in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Fellow coworkers are amazing people!
cons: Management and Human Resources are not pro-employee.  Very difficult to work for.

job_title: Medical Coding Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Some flexibility with hours. Great coworkers. Option to work from home twice a week.
cons: It is difficult to get questions answered because everyone is so busy.

review_title: Great until HealthPartners purchased Park Nicollet
job_title: Pharmacist in Minnetonka, MN
pros: Amazing coworkers!  We have a staff that is patient focused and professional.  The Carlson clinic has been a wonderful place to work.
cons: Pharmacy is no longer seen as a necessary component to the healthcare model.  A vital resource for professionals will be gone.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bloomington, MN
pros: Plenty of PTO, excellent benefits
cons: No career development or promotions despite excelling at what you do.  This "road block" once you get to a certain role will force anyone who cares about their career to find work elsewhere.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Park Nicollet has always been my
Healthcare provider and I like the doctors in their network.
cons: My manager was not a good leader. He needed training on how to communicate better and how to work better with women. He made it impossible to work there and forced me to leave.

review_title: Laboratory Assistant - great coworkers, alright place.
job_title: Laboratory Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Coworkers are a wonderful helpful team. Give Benefits for part time (over .6 FTE). Wonderful immediate supervisor.
cons: Some management don't respect you. (some do) Difficult and stressful work environment. Not static shift schedule (changes week to week which gets very frustrating).

review_title: Pay rate is crippling and there is no negotiation on increasing wages.
job_title: Anonymous in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Health, dental, 401k, PTO bank.
cons: HR and hiring recruiters are out of reach and out of touch with internal talent searching for other opportunities within the company.

review_title: Park Nicollet - So far so good.
job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Minneapolis, MN

cons: Park Nicollet is a very large company and it can be difficult to see outside the department you work in.

job_title: Non-MD Provider in Saint Louis Park, MN

Co-workers are wonderful and supportive for the most part 
Interesting patient mix with varied medical needs
Nice physical work environment in clinics
cons:
Oppressive management practices, actual practice does not correspond to published corporate mission statement
Non-MD's are not respected nor compensated fairly.
Merged with Group Health January 2013, uncertain future for PNC employees
Under-staffed in all areas since economic down turn

review_title: I am a digit in a balance sheet
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: I enjoy working with the patients. I enjoy working with my fellow nurses
cons: Senior management make decisions ignoring front line workers.  They have fired workers with 30 years experience and good employee reviews.

job_title: Administrative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I enjoy working at Park Nicollet. It's close to my home. They have good core values of Head+Heart Together. My coworkers are like family.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement a higher level administrative assistant.

job_title: Physician in Plymouth, MN
pros: Great staff but constantly going through staff due to bad management since healthpartners took over.

job_title: in Minneapolis, MN

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Plymouth, MN
pros: Pay, benefits, work/life balance, values, training, and resources available. Clinic Manager at Plymouth is great to work for; personable, approachable, respectful, and very kind.
cons: Plymouth Nursing Supervisor - Too many reasons to list.

review_title: Great organization to work for and grow in!
job_title: Primary Care Services Representative in Wayzata, MN
pros: Great leadership teams! Great Growth Opportunities!

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Saint Louis Park, MN

cons: A lot of "politics" amongst workers, very hard to get PTO approved (no matter the reason), management and staffing are a mess and don't listen to your needs.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Maple Grove, MN
pros: The hours ,is about the only thing,some of the older co workers have the good work ethics the younger ones don't but supervisors don't say anything to them
cons: Like stated in early comment if your not in the in crowd it can be hard to work ,I am here for patient care ,we are not in high school ,pay not good ,benefits not good either

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Saint Louis Park, MN

cons: Level of care can interfere with education. They are not a trauma hospital and their Special Care Nursery is only a level 2.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: I felt welcomed as a new employee. Everyone on the healthcare team is valued and it doesn't feel like a hierarchy; Everyone is part of the team. Patient focused; everyone's motive is to make the patient's experience and treatment better.
cons: None come to mind right now

job_title: Dietary Aide in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: it's a paycheck.... Coworkers are friendly and enjoy working together. The benefits are good. Enjoy seeing patients.

job_title: Dietetic Technician in Saint Louis Park, MN

cons: Little guidance from management at any time.

review_title: Pay rate was fair and the balance of work was fair.

cons: Not always very understanding about personal issues and it affects productivity.  Too much focus on productivity and not as much focus on quality of work.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Park Nicollet cares about every employee, no matter what the title. The CEO meets every new hire personally at a conference and overviews his vision with you for the company. Very inspiring.
cons: Minneapolis' commuter issues may arise.

job_title: Marketing Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The benefits are good and the people are fun to work with.

review_title: The coworkers are great, the management needs work.

review_title: Time in is worth the pay out

job_title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist in Saint Louis Park, MN

review_title: No way to move up and no standards
job_title: Scheduler in Minneapolis, MN
